		Question: what did baron de montesquie influence
		Answer:
answer:
The answer is: 

Baron de Montesquieu was a 18th-century French philosopher whose work on political theory and law influenced the development of liberalism, republicanism, federalism and the American, French, and English revolutions, as well as the establishment of constitutional government in the Western world. The idea of separation of powers, of justice, and the rule of law were central to his political philosophy. One of his most important contributions to political philosophy was his theory of judicial precedent.
